Linked Data Definitions

Source: R/definitions.R
uklr_def.Rd

These functions return the definitions for the linked data construction in a tibble.

uklr_def()

ukhp_def()

ukppd_def()

uktrans_def()

Examples


uklr_def()

ukhp_def()
#> # A tibble: 155 x 20
#>    uri   label comment component_uri component_attri~ component_attri~
#>    <chr> <fct> <fct>   <lgl>         <fct>            <fct>           
#>  1 Mont~ UK h~ A dist~ NA            ""               ""              
#>  2 Mont~ UK h~ A dist~ NA            ""               ""              
#>  3 aver~ Aver~ "Avera~ NA            ""               ""              
#>  4 aver~ Aver~ "Avera~ NA            ""               ""              
#>  5 aver~ Aver~ Averag~ NA            ""               ""              
#>  6 aver~ Aver~ Averag~ NA            ""               ""              
#>  7 aver~ Aver~ Averag~ NA            ""               ""              
#>  8 aver~ Aver~ Averag~ NA            ""               ""              
#>  9 aver~ Aver~ Averag~ NA            ""               ""              
#> 10 aver~ Aver~ Averag~ NA            ""               ""              
#> # ... with 145 more rows, and 14 more variables: component_uri1 <lgl>,
#> #   component_dimension <fct>, component_dimension_uri <fct>,
#> #   component_uri2 <lgl>, component_measure <fct>, component_measure_uri <fct>,
#> #   range <fct>, range_uri <fct>, subclassof <fct>, subclassof_uri <fct>,
#> #   type <fct>, type_uri <fct>, unit <fct>, unit_uri <fct>
